Articles.Content:
As the title says, what's your favorite/least favorite environments? 

My favorite environment is my cold, dark room with the only light coming from my phone.

My least favorite environment is a hot and sunny summer day.
Decently lit room with a nice comfy couch so I can watch TV very comfortably. Warm, too.

Well, that really depends on what I'm doing.

If I'm trying to sleep or play video games, then a dark room is preferred.

If I'm trying to wake up, I prefer it bright and sunny.  Because otherwise I'd never get out of bed

At work, I prefer a comfy chair and a PC screen that doesn't hurt my eyes.  I'd prefer a quieter office location (rather than next to a very busy intersection) but hey, you can't have everything.

If I'm relaxing (not playing video games) then somewhere outside, with plants and a cool breeze.  Having lots of green (plants) makes me feel more relaxed.

If I'm vacationing (which has been a few years, but hey maybe soon) either forest or desert.  Basically, somewhere remote.

 

Least favorite: noisy, crowded, dark, closed-in places.  Like dance clubs, or raves, or places like that.  Not a fan.

Edited January 18, 2016 by Slam_Jones

Hawaii.

25 degrees is pretty much my optimal temperature (77F). It's warm enough to be comfortable on it's own, and cool enough that I don't mind being in direct sunlight. Depending on the time of year, I prefer outside to inside, particularly in June and July when I find local insect life to be most pleasant for the warm months. You have a lot fewer of things like wasps and spiders (or rather, the webs they spin in easy to walk into places) before August I find. I'm also pretty used to ocean breezes and high humidity. I also like the occasional thunderstorm, mostly for the heavy rain. It makes a pleasing sound on the roof I find very relaxing (even more so than ocean surf).

 

That said, I do appreciate a good winter, in small doses. I'm pretty fond of downhill skiing, and winter isn't complete without a good round of winter paintball. I am however not a fan of cold, really anything at or below -10 (14F) and I'm going to be unhappy.

Indoors, dark, 25°C, quiet or with rave music playing, depending on mood.
As for outdoors, Winter is my favorite season, particularly when there's snow involved.

Most favorite: In the middle of a forest, alone.... day or night doesn't matter.

Least favorite: Crowded noisy room.

Favorite: A warm room with no one around me, with the only light coming from a dim lamp and KSP.

Least favorite: Anything below 9-8 degrees C.

On 1/18/2016 at 8:34 PM, CAKE99 said:

My favorite environment is my cold, dark room with the only light coming from my phone.

I imagine your eyeballs love you.

Favourite environment for what?

I would enjoy a nice dimmed spa room with aromatic candles for relaxing, and I would dare say it is one of my favourite environment. But certainly I wouldn't want to live there. If I live, I prefer to live in a clean, urban environment with carefully controlled climate and separation from the chaos that is nature.

Favorite environment : Warm, dry room for work, and video games.

Least favorite environment : Forests at night (I like it, but i'm so afraid that something going to jump on me), direct sunlight.
Reading all of these... I wonder how pale we all are

favourite environment?  Deserts.  Long, clear distant views.  Silence.  Elbow-room.  Clear starry nights.  Bliss.  American deserts are my favourites because they have distant mountains to give some interest to the horizon.

Least favourite?  Noisy, crowded bars and pubs.  I am a miserable old git.

im a cat

Edited January 21, 2016 by Nuke

3 hours ago, Spaceception said:

Reading all of these... I wonder how pale we all are

Most people don't believe I really live in Florida. The rest are convinced I'm a vampire.

Edited January 21, 2016 by Frybert

3 minutes ago, Frybert said:

Most people don't believe I really live in Florida. The rest are convinced I'm a vampire.

Wait... Do you live near Brandenton?
Nope. Closer to Orlando.

Just now, Frybert said:

Nope. Closer to Orlando.

I was thinking we could've done a meetup

3 hours ago, Spaceception said:

Reading all of these... I wonder how pale we all are

I'm not going to lie, the colour change I go through each summer (or visit Florida/Hawaii for like 3 days) is pretty spectacular, as is my bodies adamant refusal to fully untan itself in the winter. I mean, I still revert to 'on the pale side', but not my natural "all my colour comes from flushed blood vessels" pale. I'm half healthy peach and half vampire pink/white
Best, any 20C-plus sunny day (up to, say, 30C) on a veranda, with a G&T. Least would be any day with snow.

Whenever I use my computer I stay in my bedroom with my curtains shut and air conditioning. I like just clouds blocking out every single patch of blue sky. Rain would be nice too.

On January 21, 2016 at 8:09 AM, Spaceception said:

Reading all of these... I wonder how pale we all are

I'm actually REALLY tan...

Favorite: Anything that isn't in my least favourite...

Least favourite: Cold and wet.  I'm quite happy with cold and dry, or wet and mild, but I bloody hate cold and wet.  Which is unfortunate as I'm British.

Best environment for me: Showering with the water at the perfect temperature.

Worst environment: Trying to sleep in Beijing during the summer.

Edited January 26, 2016 by CelticCossack51

Favourite: Downtown Helsinki in late winter/early spring (or late fall/early winter), dark (early evening, around 6 o'clock), two or three degrees above 0 celsius, somewhat windy with a bit of rain or sleet. Lots of traffic, colorful lights and people going about their business.

Least favourite: Countryside in the summer, no wind, no clouds, well over 30 degrees celsius.

 

Yes, I love rain, darkness and cold-ish weather.

Edited January 26, 2016 by CaptainKorhonen

A lodge, made out of lacquered wood logs, in the Canadian wilderness. No roads or connections to society.

I want internet though.

Favorite: Middle of summer, Middle of nowhere. with a tent, my dogs, an axe for campfires, and the ability to move camp within an hours notice. Oh and a few firearms. because shooting things is fun. (Preferably in Texas or North Carolina)

 

Least favorite:
School.

Edited January 27, 2016 by Kozak
